result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa A. Banda

records.addlTxt: Judicial Pretrial - in court on December 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
JPTC for 10/26/22 adjourned to 12/09/22 at 11:00 am on court's motion; court unavailable on previously scheduled date.  Confirming email sent to parties.

Defendant, Melissa A. Banda, appeared with Attorney David Patton.  Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

03:09 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney David Patton. Clerk PU. Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am. @ 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI. Time waived.   Bond continued w/ same conditions. DE waives time for the preliminary hearing. mi
